summary: Employees who leave DOD to work for DOD contractors may face restrictions designed to protect against conflicts of interest. For example, they are permanently prohibited from attempting to influence their former agency about a project they worked on. Congress recently added restrictions on lobbying by former DOD officials. We found DOD improved its efforts to inform departing employees of post-government employment restrictions through training and...
title: Post-Government Employment Restrictions: DOD Could Further Enhance Its Compliance Efforts Related to Former Employees Working for Defense Contractors
